newsitem.title: USA: General Bearing signs $54 million GM contract.
newsitem.headline: General Bearing signs $54 million GM contract.

text.p: General Bearing Corp. said Thursday it has signed a three-year, $54 million agreement to supply wheel and axle bearings to General Motors Corp.
The company said it expects to ship about $12 million of the products in 1998 and $18 million annually after that for the life of the contract.

General Bearing, based in West Nyack, N.Y., said it is in discussions with the other major U.S. car companies. The company makes and distributes a variety of bearing components and bearing products. General Bearing's stock rose $1.25 to $8.625 on the New York Stock Exchange shortly before midday.
